question: It's all right, Mom. Go back to bed. Stay away monters, stay away ghouls. Stay away from Danny. You jerks know the rules. Better?
answer: Mommy, when can we go home?

question: Home is here in Grandma and Grandpa's new house. At least while I'm in college. Remember our deal.
answer: The kids at school said this is a haunted house -- that a bad man used to live here.

question: They did, did they? Since when did we start listening to the kids at school?
answer: But I've seen him!

question: You've been watching too much TV.
answer: He says things. Bad things.

question: Like what? If you mean the things Grandpa says sometimes, ignore him. Once he gets to know you he'll come around ... Let the bad things you hear slide right off your back.
answer: No, Mom -- keep it on!

question: Not dead. Just very much retired. What the devil?! Come in -- come in!
answer: Christ, what a night! Not even so much as a sign for five miles on that road!

question: That's the whole idea of living in the country. I thrive on the seclusion.
answer: Don't tell me that the reviled Rasputin of Smith's Grove has grown complacent in his golden years. I don't buy it for a single second, Dr. Loomis.

question: And in all these years, I've never known you to make house calls, Dr. Wynn. Especially at this hour ...
answer: Unlike you, Sam, I learned many years ago not to second-guess the motives of my fellow man. Remember what Freud said

question: I hope you didn't come all the way out here in this storm just to quote Freud.
answer: As always, your keen powers of perception astound me. And you're right. I've come to celebrate. After thirty-two years as Psychiatric Administrator, guess who has been named Smith's Groves new Chief of Staff.

question: But surely Rogers isn't --
answer: Retiring.

question: Why -- congratulations! I can think of no one better suited for the position.
answer: Of course, I need a new Administrator. Someone who can bring new life -- and some old blood, if you'll pardon the expression -- back to our program ... We need you, Dr. Loomis.

question: You should know that it's not wise to play Halloween pranks on me.
answer: You're the only man for the job, Sam. Things haven't been the same since you left. I'm recruiting the best psychiatric team in the country. Old colleagues. This is your change to finally make a difference.

question: Even after my stroke six years ago they practically had to hold a gun to my head to get me to retire. Now things have changed. I've changed. The ghosts have been buried. Why on earth would I want to dig them up again?
answer: Seems to me there's at least one ghost that's still lurking in your closet.

question: It's ... Michael ... ... Michael Myers! Somebody help me! Dr. Loomis, are you out there? Can you hear me? has locked herself inside one of the stalls. Heart pounding. The FOOTSTEPS grow louder. Jamie's eyes dart frantically.
answer: Jamie sighs with relief, steadying the wheel just as --

question: is jolted forward in her seat. Holding on the wheel with a white-knuckle grip as she's repeatedly hit from behind. No!!!
answer: The truck plows into the Shape, dragging it under, SLAMMING headlong into the trunk of a huge oak tree.

question: It was her voice. On the radio. It was Jamie. Calling for me.
answer: You don't know that for sure. It could have been anyone. A practical joke. Kids.

question: It was Jamie Lloyd. She came back, as I knew she would one day. And whatever has brought her back has brought Michael back as well.
answer: After six years? Sam, she died with him in that explosion after the --

question: That's what someone wants us to believe, but I tell you Michael is alive. I feel him. I sense the evil that lives inside, just as I did all those years as I watched him. Sitting behind these very same walls. Staring. Growing stronger. As my colleague, as my friend, please. I can't go through this again. Not alone. I need your help to stop him.
answer: Cancel all my appointments. Get Dr. Loomis anything he needs -- files, tests, records of every treatment ever administered to a former patient of ours -- Michael Myers. That's right. We think there's a very good chance he might still be alive. Notify Haddonfield's sheriff; tell him we're on our way. I want the entire staff on alert. We go to code red lockdown for twenty-four hours. If he is alive, I plan on bringing him back.

question: Reality check, dillweed. This is 1995. See you tonight, Mrs. Blankenship!
answer: Beth, who's that guy that lives across the hall from you?

question: Why? You interested?
answer: No! I keep seeing him staring out his window. Watching me.

question: You must be Sheriff Holdt.
answer: As a matter of fact, I am. And I take it you're the infamous Dr. Loomis.

question: I'd like to introduce you to Terence Wynn, the Chief of Staff at --
answer: Smith's Grove. They told me you'd be coming. Now I suggest you fly right on back to your crackpot asylum. You people got no business in my town.

question: Michael Myers is my business.
answer: I want you to listen and listen good, Loomis. Things have been quiet for six years and that's the way they're gonna stay. The last thing we need is you spouting off your ghost stories.

question: Dr. Loomis!
answer: Yes?

question: Dr. Loomis, thank God you're here. You heard her, didn't you? It was Jamie.
answer: I'm sorry, but do I know you --

question: I'm Tommy. Tommy Doyle. Laurie Strode -- Jamie's mother -- she was baby-sitting for me that night --
answer: Yes ... Tommy. What are you doing here?

question: Please -- just tell me the truth. Has Michael Myers come home?
answer: What do you know about Michael?

question: I know he's alive. People in this town -- they want us to believe he's dead. But I know. I've always known.
answer: Right now at least one girl is dead and Jamie Lloyd is in there fighting for her life. She is the last of his blood line. If she dies --

question: No, Dr. Loomis. She's not the last night. Oh, God -- his cousins. The Strodes. They're living in the Myers house! I gotta go.
answer: Tommy, wait!

question: An old friend.
answer: Great.

question: I'm very sorry, Mrs. Strode. I've been knocking. The door was open. Is everything all right in here?
answer: Who are you?

question: Michael Myers was just six-years-old when he stabbed his sister to death in 1963. Here in this house. For the next fifteen years, I became obsessed with finding out what was living inside of him. He was my lift's work and my ultimate failure. I knew what he was but I never knew why. There's a living force inside of him. Driving him. And I fear that somehow it has been unleashed again. He crept up these stairs and made his way into this room. His sister's room. Right here. Where it all began.
answer: What makes you think he'll come here again?

question: This house is sacred to him. It's the source of his memories -- his rage. Mrs. Strode, I beg you. Don't let your family suffer the same fast as Laurie and her daughter.
answer: Jamie? But I thought she was --

question: This force which drives him, which keeps him alive, comes from something more powerful -- more deadly than we can possibly imagine. The embodiment of all that is evil.
answer: What should I do?

question: Lock the doors and call your husband. Get your family as far away from Haddonfield as possible.
answer: God ... this can't be true.

question: Strode Realty.
answer: John, it's me. Something terrible has happened.

question: What is it this time?
answer: A man came by the house. A psychiatrist by the name of Loomis. He told me about the terrible things that happened here. In our house.

question: What the fuck are you doing letting strangers in without --
answer: John, they sound Jamie Lloyd this morning! Someone tried to kill her!

question: What in God's name are you talking about, woman? When are you gonna stop listening to those damned talk shows?
answer: I'm getting the children out of here. At least until we know what we're dealing with. John, I want you to come with us.

question: Debra, you're fuckin' insane.
answer: You knew, didn't you, John? You knew.

question: Trick-or-treat to you, too.
answer: Hello?

question: Mom, I'm home ... Hello? Mom? Mom? ... Danny? Mom? Are you there? Who the hell are you?
answer: I-I'm your neighbor from across the street. My name's Tommy. Tommy Doyle.

question: What are you doing with my son? Where's my mother?
answer: She wasn't here when I brought Danny home from --

question: God, what's wrong with him?
answer: Here. Let me try. There. All it takes is a mother's touch.

question: Kyle's mother might be dead for all I know. Now I'm afraid he could be next.
answer: Why would anyone want to kill an innocent baby?

question: Not just Kyle. All of you. His entire family. Here. Look at this. It was there when I found him this morning. It looks like some kind of letter or number or --
answer: It's a rune ... Thorn.

question: I'm very sorry ...
answer: You let it get to her. How could you?

question: Dr. Loomis, there's something else you should know. During surgery, we discovered that Jamie's uterus was hemorrhaging. We found this. It's placental fluid.
answer: God in heaven. You don't tell me she was --

question: Runes were a kind of early alphabet that originated in Northern Europe thousands of years ago. They were symbols -- carved out of stone or pieces of wood. Of all the runes, Thorn had the most negative influence. Cults used them in blood rituals to portend future events and invoke magic.
answer: Black magic ... 'In ancient times, Thorn was believed to cause sickness, famine and death. Translated literally, it was the name of a demon spirit that delivered human sacrifices ... on the Celtic celebration of Samhain.'

question: Halloween.
answer: 'When applied directly to another person, Thorn could be used to call upon them confusion and destruction -- to literally visit them with the Devil.'

question: Where are you going?
answer: To find the rest of your family before Michael Myers does -- or whoever's been controlling him.

question: Oh, God -- Where's Danny? Kara flies down the hall, the baby in her arms. Tommy moves out right behind her. Danny?! Danny!
answer: Mrs. Blankenship, have you seen the little boy who came in with me and --

question: Who's gettin' busted?
answer: Jesus, that's my neighbor. Tommy.

question: Isn't he that psycho who's been spying on my sister?
answer: Kara and Danny never showed up tonight. We'd better go home and check on them. There's nothing else for us to do here.

question: But they're gonna light the tree in a few minutes --
answer: We can light our own tree at home.

question: Dr. Loomis, there's something you should know --
answer: I know enough already. Just shut your mouth and take me to that baby.

question: Oh my God --
answer: Tommy!

question: Mommy, I'm scared.
answer: There's nothing to be scared of, baby. It's just another storm. Try to get some sleep.

question: I can't. The voice man is coming to get me.
answer: No one's coming to get you. Not while I'm around.

question: Promise?
answer: I promise. Beth, are you in there?

question: Aren't you gonna answer that?
answer: Answer what?

question: What if it's Kara?
answer: Fine. You answer it. I'll make friends with my soap on a rope.

question: Mom -- Who is this?
answer: Kara? ... No, this is Beth.

question: What are you doing there? Where's my mother?
answer: We were worried about you guys so we left early to see if you were --

question: Is Tim there?
answer: He's in the bathroom.

question: Danny, no!!! shoots across the lawn. Up the porch steps. Right behind him. Danny? Come on ... Danny, please. Danny, run!!!
answer: careens down the stairs. THUNDER RAGES.

question: brandishes the fireplace poker at the killer. The Shape moves in, backing her through the bathroom ... into Danny's room. Suddenly she SLAMS the door on the Shape. Danny, come to Mommy.
answer: Mommy!!!

question: He's gone. Who else knew I had the baby?!
answer: No one.

question: No -- there had to be someone else. Who knew?!
answer: Only me -- -- and Dr. Wynn. Wynn!!! Run, Tommy!!! Run!!!

question: What is this all about? Remove those!
answer: Where's the child?

question: Sam, you know you never fail to amaze me. Yesterday happily retired, today right back in the thick of things. Somehow I knew you still had it in you. Come now, Sam. This is a gathering of old friends. I know how difficult this must be for you -- a man of your upbringing and integrity -- but now that I'm in charge I felt it was only fair that you finally know the truth. After all, you're the only one around here who's still in the dark, as it were. This isn't the way I wanted to tell you, but you've really given me no other choice.
answer: This is madness, Wynn.

question: Your madness is another man's greatness. This is the way things have always been. You've just been too blinded by your own reality to see. But having you on the outside has been convenient for us in many ways. You always did come through -- our loyal watch dog. Finding him. Bringing him back to us once he'd finished his work. Although after you had that nasty stroke the last time, I had to go after him myself. And what a terrible time we had getting him out of that jail cell.
answer: It was you.

question: Sometimes a cigar is just a cigar.
answer: Why did you take Jamie?

question: She has the gift -- the blood of Thorn running through her veins. Michael's mother had it, too. So for six years I incubated her, prepared her for this night. Michael has served his purpose. And soon we will have a new progeny.
answer: Jamie's baby ...

question: There you go trying to make sense again. It's a curse. Handed down through countless generations. As ageless as this celebration which you call Halloween.
answer: Samhain.

question: And I'm its deliverer. Its calling card, if you will. I follow it. Protect it. Act as its guardian. In a sense, Sam, so do you. I know you have more questions, my friend, and there's so much more for you to try to make sense of. Look at him. So silent, yet so deadly. He moves when I tell him to. Act on my impulses. Feels what I feel. Michael -- Rise. Michael -- Pain. Michael -- Kill.
answer: You've created a monster.

question: Behind, Disciples of Thorn! The final sign! The birth of the heretic child, delivered unto us on the eve of our great Feast of the Sun ... as I have foreseen it. Spirits and powers of the flame, attend and witness this ritual. Bear our gifts to Thorn. Open us to the path of Darkness. By these runes transform us. Open our eyes and show us the Chosen One to whom we offer this sacrifice of Innocent Blood.
answer: Danny!!!

question: Strong and fierce Thorn, Thundered, by thy hammer we summon thee and offer this sacrifice of innocent blood. Let thy Darkness descend on your son. Danny. Lord of the Dead. Kill for him, Danny ... Kill for him.
answer: Michael, please. You can make him stop. You remember, don't you? Remember what he did to you that night. What his voice told you to do. You can stop it, Michael. Stop the voice forever.

question: Kill him, Danny. Kill him!
answer: Danny, don't listen! The voice isn't real!

question: Kill him, Danny! You feel the rage inside! You are Thorn!
answer: No!!!

question: Stay away, Sam.
answer: Leave the boy. Take me.
